Coiled Opportunity.name: Coiled Opportunity
Coiled Opportunity.description: As Attack of Opportunity, but the serpent can use this reaction only if it's coiled.

Coil.name: Coil
Coil.description: The serpent uses an action to coil itself; increasing its reach with its fangs from 5 feet to 10 feet. After the serpent strikes with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.

Lightning Rattle.name: Lightning Rattle
Lightning Rattle.description:
The serpent rattles its strange metal tail and unleashes a bolt of lightning in a 60-foot line. The bolt deals [[/r {2d10}[electricity]]]{2d10 electricity damage} (basic Reflex save).

Once the giant lightning serpent uses this ability, it must wait [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before doing so again.

Shattering Hooves.name: Shattering Hooves
Shattering Hooves.description: The hooves of the stone horse are as hard as iron; if the horse makes a Hoof Strike and gets a critical hit, the target's armor is damaged as well, the attack dealing as much damage to the armor as it dealt to the target (Hardness applies as normal). If the target uses shield block against the stone horse's critical hit with a hoof attack, treat the shield's Hardness as 5 points lower (minimum 0).

Hide.name: Hide
Hide.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

Ferocity.name: Ferocity
Ferocity.description:
Trigger The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its wounded value increases by 1. When it is wounded 3, it can no longer use this ability.

No Escape.name: No Escape
No Escape.description:
Trigger An adjacent foe moves away.

Effect Lord Nar may move up to his speed but must end his move as close to the triggering creature as possible without entering the triggering creature's square.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
The monster flies into a rage that lasts 1 minute and grants him 8 temporary Hit Points, 4 additional damage with his listed attacks, and a -1 penalty to AC.

It cannot use actions that have the concentrate trait while raging, unless they also have the rage trait. Once his rage ends, the monster cannot Rage again for 1 minute.

Fiery Pelt.name: Fiery Pelt
Fiery Pelt.description: Creatures that start their turn grappled by a fiery leopard take 1d4 fire damage. Anyone attempting to grapple a fiery leopard takes 1d4 fire damage for each attempt.

Durable Farm Cloths.name: Durable Farm Cloths
Durable Farm Cloths.description: This armor is simply a layer of heavy, quilted cloth, but it is sometimes used because it's so inexpensive. Padded armor is easier to damage and destroy than other types of armor. Heavy armor comes with a padded armor undercoat included in its Price, though it loses the comfort trait when worn under heavy armor. You can wear just that padded armor or undercoat to sleep in, if your heavy armor is destroyed, or when otherwise not wearing the full heavy armor. This allows you to keep the armor invested and benefit from the power of any runes on the associated heavy armor, but no one else can wear your heavy armor without the padded undercoat.

Bloodlash Bush.name: Bloodlash Bush
Bloodlash Bush.description:
What first appears to be a simple shrub suddenly stirs to life.

The bloodlash bush attempts to lacerate its foes, using its weeping wounds to irrigate the ground around itself. The seeds of a bloodlash bush can take root only in soil that has been soaked in blood.

Blood Siphon.name: Blood Siphon
Blood Siphon.description: The tendrils of the bush reach out to siphon the blood from a victim up to 20 feet away with persistent bleed damage, causing the victim to immediately take that amount of bleed damage (basic Reflex). The bush regains an amount of Hit Points equal to double the damage dealt.

Spinning Strike.name: Spinning Strike
Spinning Strike.description: The bush spins in a circle, lashing out in all directions at once. It makes one attack roll and compares the result to the AC of each creature within its melee reach, rolling damage only once and applying it to each creature hit.

Weeping Wounds.name: Weeping Wounds
Weeping Wounds.description: A bloodlash bush's vines cause terrible lacerations that continue to bleed. A creature hit with a vine attack takes [[/r 1 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} ([[/r 2 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} on a critical hit). Unlike other forms of persistent damage, this damage is cumulative, to a maximum of 5 persistent bleed damage but it can be stopped like any other persistent bleed damage.

Icy Death.name: Icy Death
Icy Death.description: When an icy rat is slain, its body explodes in a burst of frozen fur and bone, dealing [[/r {2d4}[cold]]]{2d4 cold damage} to all adjacent reatures (basic Reflex save).

+1 Striking Dagger.name: +1 Striking Dagger
+1 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The thick second skin of the armor disperses blunt force to reduce bludgeoning damage. You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + the value of the armor's potency rune for medium armor, or 2 + the value of the armor's potency rune for heavy armor.

Vilree's Belt Pouch.name: Vilree's Belt Pouch
Vilree's Belt Pouch.description:
A belt pouch holds up to four items of light Bulk.

Contains 2 pp, 38gp and 4sp

Bracers of Missile Deflection.name: Bracers of Missile Deflection
Bracers of Missile Deflection.description:
These bracers are made from plates of durable mithral and gleam like the summer sun.

Activate R Interact

Frequency once per day

Trigger A ranged weapon attack hits you but doesn't critically hit

Requirements You are aware of the attack and not flat-footed

Effect The bracers send the missile off-course. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this would cause the attack to be a failure, the attack misses you.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.PeiuJ951kkBPTCSM]{Effect: Bracers of Missile Deflection}

Potion of Fire Resistance (Lesser).name: Potion of Fire Resistance (Lesser)
Potion of Fire Resistance (Lesser).description:
Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants resistance against a single damage type for 1 hour. Eachpotion of resistanceis created to defend against acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (and is called alesser potion of fire resistanceor the like).

You gain resistance 5 to the appropriate energy type.

ActivateInteract

Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser).name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser)
Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser).description: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant. The bonus is +1, you gain 5 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 minute.

Stone Body Mutagen (Lesser).name: Stone Body Mutagen (Lesser)
Stone Body Mutagen (Lesser).description:
This mutagen calcifies your body making it as hard as stone.

Benefit You gain resistance 5 to physical damage (except bludgeoning) and the duration is 10 minutes.

Drawback Your Speeds are reduced by 10 feet (minimum 5 feet) and you take a -2 penalty to Reflex saves.

ActivateInteract

Energy Mutagen (Moderate).name: Energy Mutagen (Moderate)
Energy Mutagen (Moderate).description: When created, this mutagen is attuned to your choice of one of four energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. When consumed, the mutagen suffuses your body with energy that spills out of you whenever you attack. At higher levels, it can even grant you the ability to unleash the energy in controlled bursts. You gain resistance 10, add 1d4 damage on a hit with a melee weapon, and the duration is 10 minutes.

Alchemical Crossbow.name: Alchemical Crossbow
Alchemical Crossbow.description: The monster's crossbow can deliver bolts that are alchemically infused. As an action, it can slot an alchemical bomb into the crossbow, and the next 3 attacks it makes with it deal 1d6 damage of the type dealt by the bomb. These attacks never deal splash damage.

Alchemy.name: Alchemy
Alchemy.description: The monster has used its alchemy ability to create 4 moderate acid flasks, 6 moderate alchemist's fire, 2 moderate bottled lightnings, 3 lesser elixirs of life, and 2 lesser tanglefoot bags. These are infusions. It can spend an action to create an additional vial of any one of these items, or any of the items listed as formulas in its book.

Far Lobber.name: Far Lobber
Far Lobber.description: The monster's bombs have a range increment of 30 feet.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: The monster can interact to draw a bomb and then make a Strike with it.

+1 Kukri.name: +1 Kukri
+1 Kukri.description: The blade of this footâ€‘long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The thick second skin of the armor disperses blunt force to reduce bludgeoning damage. You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + the value of the armor's potency rune for medium armor, or 2 + the value of the armor's potency rune for heavy armor.

Bolts (10).name: Bolts (10)
Bolts (10).description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Healing Potion (Lesser).name: Healing Potion (Lesser)
Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain the listed number of Hit Points.

Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser).name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser)
Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser).description: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant. The bonus is +1, you gain 5 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 minute.

Dirty Trick.name: Dirty Trick
Dirty Trick.description:
Trigger Hallod scores a critical hit with a melee attack.

Effect Hallod can attempt an Athletics check to Shove or Trip the target of his attack. This uses the same multiple attack penalty as the attack, but it does not count as an additional attack for that penalty

One-Two Move.name: One-Two Move
One-Two Move.description: Hallod makes two Strikes, one with each hand; he usually attacks first with his kukri. If this first attack hits, the target is flat-footed to the second attack (which for Hallod is usually a fist Strike). The multiple attack penalty applies to these attacks as normal

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Hallod deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

Massive Strike.name: Massive Strike
Massive Strike.description: The monster makes a melee Strike and, if the attack hits, it can push the creature back 10 feet (20 feet on a critical hit). The target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be knocked prone by this attack.

Stomp.name: Stomp
Stomp.description: The monster can stomp on the ground, causing all creatures within 10 feet to fall prone (Reflex save negates).

Empathy Link.name: Empathy Link
Empathy Link.description: The monster can't speak, but its mind is linked to its creator. It can share basic emotional information with its creator, such as fear, happiness, or anger. If the monster is destroyed, its master automatically knows this. The range of this link is 1,500 feet.

Beestings.name: Beestings
Beestings.description: The creature must attempt a Fortitude save. Those who fail take [[/r {1d4}[poison]]]{1d4 poison damage} and are clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

Swarming Stings.name: Swarming Stings
Swarming Stings.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage} (basic Reflex save). The first time each round a creature fails the save and takes piercing damage, it also suffers the effect of beestings. Whenever the bee swarm uses this ability, the swarm takes 1 damage.

Howl.name: Howl
Howl.description: The wolf unleashes a terrifying howl, allowing it to Demoralize all enemies within 30 feet. Wolves within 100 feet can spend a reaction to join the howl, causing the effect to emanate from them as well. This affects additional enemies within 30 feet of them and uses the caustic wolf's Intimidation check with a -4 circumstance penalty. Enemies cannot be affected by the howl more than once, even if they are near more than one howling wolf. All creatures targeted by this effect are temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
The wolf unleashes a stream of bright green acid from its mouth, coating all creatures in a 30-foot line. All creatures in the line take [[/r {3d6}[acid]]]{3d6 acid damage} (basic Reflex save).

The caustic wolf cannot use this ability again for 1 minute.

Tear.name: Tear
Tear.description:
Trigger The wolf dealt damage to a creature with its jaws during the previous action.

Effect The wolf tears at the creature's flesh, dealing 1d6+2 slashing damage and 1 persistent acid damage.

Gore Spray.name: Gore Spray
Gore Spray.description:
Trigger A creature critically hits a mutant wolf while adjacent to it.

Effect The wound causes gore to spray from a ruptured pustule. The triggering creature takes [[/r {3d6}[acid]]]{3d6 acid damage} (basic Reflex save). This occurs even if the attack kills the wolf.

Acid Flask (Lesser).name: Acid Flask (Lesser)
Acid Flask (Lesser).description:
This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, the listed persistent acid damage, and the listed acid splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

It deals 1d6 persistent acid damage and 1 acid splash damage.

ActivateStrike

Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).name: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals the listed fire damage, persistent fire damage, and splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

The bomb deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

ActivateStrike

Bottled Lightning (Lesser).name: Bottled Lightning (Lesser)
Bottled Lightning (Lesser).description: Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals the listed electricity damage and electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. It deals 1d6 electricity damage and 1 electricity splash damage.

Elixir of Life (Minor).name: Elixir of Life (Minor)
Elixir of Life (Minor).description: Elixirs of life accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 1d6 Hit Points, and the bonus is +1.

Ferocity.name: Ferocity
Ferocity.description:
Trigger The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its wounded value increases by 1. When it is wounded 3, it can no longer use this ability.

Blood Ooze.name: Blood Ooze
Blood Ooze.description:
Swelling like a bubble about to burst, this oozing thing looks like it is made entirely from blood. Its slick, crimson skin is marred only by spots that look like clots formed on the surface.

Created through the foulest of alchemical rituals, the blood ooze seeks only one thing: to increase its mass by consuming blood from the living. The blood ooze hides within the body of its victims, only bursting out to attack when another meal draws near, leaving the body a husk of its former self.

The process by which such an ooze is created involves draining the blood of at least four Medium creatures and feeding all of the collected blood to a fifth creature, along with deadly reagents designed to prevent the blood from coagulating. During this time, the host slowly dies while the blood ooze takes form, emerging 2 to 6 hours later. Blood oozes have no loyalty toward those who created them, but some creators have noted that newly formed blood oozes seem to avoid harming other members of the host creature's family.

It is not widely known that an existing blood ooze can reproduce by splitting itself in half. It undergoes this division only if it has grown so large that splitting in half would create a pair of normal-sized blood oozes, such as the one listed below.

Infuse Corpse.name: Infuse Corpse
Infuse Corpse.description: A blood ooze can seep into a corpse's wounds, displacing its natural blood. It can burst out of the corpse as a free action.

Clot.name: Clot
Clot.description: Trigger The blood ooze is damaged by a piercing or slashing attack. Effect The blood ooze forms a clot around the wound, reducing the damage taken by 5 (to a minimum of 0).

Blood Pool.name: Blood Pool
Blood Pool.description: Whenever a creature adjacent to a blood ooze takes bleed damage, the blood ooze regains an amount of Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

Siphon Vitality.name: Siphon Vitality
Siphon Vitality.description: The blood ooze draws forth blood from nearby creatures, causing their flesh to break open and blood to spill out which replenishes the blood ooze. Each living creature within 15 feet takes [[/r {3d6}[slashing]]]{3d6 slashing damage} (basic Fortitude save). The blood ooze regains an amount of Hit Points equal to half the damage Siphon Vitality dealt to the single creature that took the most damage.

Crafter's Eyepiece.name: Crafter's Eyepiece
Crafter's Eyepiece.description: This rugged metal eyepiece etched with square patterns is designed to be worn over a single eye. Twisting the lens reveals a faint three-dimensional outline of an item you plan to build or repair, with helpful labels on the component parts. While worn, this eyepiece gives you a +1 item bonus to Crafting checks. When you Repair an item, increase the Hit Points restored by 15 per proficiency rank instead of 10.

Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser).name: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)
Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser).description: This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover. Reduce your targets' circumstance bonus by 1.

Ferocity.name: Ferocity
Ferocity.description:
Trigger The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its wounded value increases by 1. When it is wounded 3, it can no longer use this ability.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: The monster can use Interact to draw a bomb and then Strike with it.

Alchemy.name: Alchemy
Alchemy.description: The monster has used its alchemy ability to create 4 moderate alchemist's fire, 2 lesser elixirs of life, and 4 moderate frost vials. These are infusions. It can spend an action to create an additional vial of any one of those, lesser bottled lightning, or a lesser acid flask.

Ice Fall Trap.name: Fall of Plaguestone
Ice Fall Trap.hazardDescription: Compartments in the ceiling are rigged to drop a freezing alchemical liquid into the entire room if the door is opened without using the key.
Ice Fall Trap.hazardDisable: Thievery DC 20 (trained) on the door allows it to be opened without springing the trap.

Fleas.name: Fleas
Fleas.description: Anyone bitten by a mangy wolf is sickened 1 for 1 minute unless they succeed at a Fortitude save, but they can spend an Interact action to scratch away the fleas and remove the condition.

Many Minds.name: Many Minds
Many Minds.description: The monster has many consciousnesses floating inside its mind, and they are not equally affected by mental magic. The monster always treats its saving throws against mental effects as one degree better.

Too Many Limbs.name: Too Many Limbs
Too Many Limbs.description: The monster can make up to four Strikes, one with each of its listed melee attacks, but no more than two at any one target. It takes a -2 penalty to each attack, but the multiple attack penalty does not increase until all the attacks are made.

+1 Studded Leather Armor.name: +1 Studded Leather Armor
+1 Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

Arrows (40).name: Arrows (40)
Arrows (40).description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Ferocity.name: Ferocity
Ferocity.description:
Trigger The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its wounded value increases by 1. When it is wounded 3, it can no longer use this ability.

Doubleshot.name: Doubleshot
Doubleshot.description: The monster can make two ranged Strikes against two different targets, each at a -2 penalty, the monster's multiple attack penalty increases only after both attacks are made.

Falling Debris.name: Fall of Plaguestone
Falling Debris.hazardDescription:
A pressure-sensitive floorboard connects to
a beam holding up debris in the crawlway's ceiling.
Falling Debris.hazardDisable:
Thievery DC 15 (trained) on the floorboard before
the debris falls

Vine Lasher.name: Vine Lasher
Vine Lasher.description:
What first appears to be a simple shrub suddenly stirs to life.

The vine lasher attacks in groups, attempting to immobilize prey and slowly tear a creature to pieces.

Light Hold.name: Light Hold
Light Hold.description: A creature grabbed by a vine lasher is not immobilized, but the grabbed creature's space and every adjacent square use the rules for difficult terrain. If the creature moves, the vine lasher moves with it, always keeping the grabbed creature within 10 feet of itself. If two or more vine lashers have a creature grabbed in this way, then the target's space and adjacent square instead use the rules for greater difficult terrain.

Grab.name: Grab
Grab.description: Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action. Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is grabbed by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the Escape action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.

Empathy Link.name: Empathy Link
Empathy Link.description: An alchemical drudge can't speak, but its mind is linked to its creator. It can share basic emotional information with its creator, such as fear, happiness, or anger. If the drudge is destroyed, its master automatically knows this. The range of this link is 1,500 feet.

Alchemical Strike.name: Alchemical Strike
Alchemical Strike.description: An alchemical drudge contains a special reservoir that can be loaded with the contents of one alchemical bomb that deals acid, cold ,electricity, or fire damage, allowing the drudge to imbue its fist attacks with this damage. Each hit deals 1d6 points of damage of the same type as that of the bomb loaded into it. Each bomb has enough fluid in it for 10 successful strikes.

Vomit Alchemy.name: Vomit Alchemy
Vomit Alchemy.description: An alchemical drudge can vomit forth a pool of caustic alchemical reagents, filling the ground in one square adjacent to the drudge. Creatures in that square when the pool is created take [[/r {2d6}[acid]]]{2d6 acid damage} (basic Reflex save). Any creature that ends its turn in a square containing a pool takes [[/r {2d6}[acid]]]{2d6 acid damage}. The pool remains for 1 minute before becoming inert.
